name: sbtr
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0

body.origin:
|- w0
-| wi(wal(s0, wsb(s0, s1, w0)), w0)
-| wsb(s0, s1, w0)

cumulated.origin:
|- w0
-| wi(wal(s0, wsb(s0, s1, w0)), w0)
-| wsb(s0, s1, w0)

body.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, wsb(s0, s1, w0)), w0)
-| wnf(s0, w0)

comment: A partial converse to ~ sbt . If the substitution of a variable for a non-free one in a wff gives a theorem, then the original wff is a theorem. (Contributed by BJ, 15-Sep-2018.)
